reviewText:
-Game is barely translated into English.
-Suffers from extreme amounts of Pay 2 Win
-No balance, and the balanced search rarely ever finds a game. ( After 1 hour + of waiting stopped trying.)
-Every patch ignores critical issues with the game. Instead they pry for more money only focusing on ways to make people spend more.
-Russian Moderators have banned several English players due to simply chatting in a language they barely understand.
- A.I and Bots wreck the game further.
- Overall it's a game that should still be in Alpha testing, and not a steam supported game. They do not provide support for English players, and auto close any tickets you may send in that aren't in Russian.

reviewText:
Not a bad free to play TBS game. Bonus is the team based pvp aspect of it, so far I've seen up to 4v4 with everyone controlling a single character.

It seems very minimalistic at this point but it's hard to judge based on my time played so far, will update the review as needed but just looking at the hotbar I don't see much else coming into play. If you've played a lot of TBS games this will be a walk in the park for you, and it's good for a beginner to get into the game.

Very similiar to XCOM style of play.

reviewText: This game is a lot of fun, has tonnes of potential, but they need to fix the pay model. It currently has too many pay to win features. If they focused more on charging players for cosmetics and lowered the monthly premuim membership cost then they would be making a move in the right direction. I recommend giving it a chance for a weekend and see if it's your thing or not. The game is good, but if they don't fix the pay model and remove the damage bonus for cash players then this game will never become popular or worth playing any further than commander level 5.

reviewText:
The localisation is a little crappy in places but if you enjoy turn based combat which rewards good strategy and don't mind playing against other players it's great.

I was worried about how many bad reviews the game had got and alot of talk of pay to win. I'm only 4 hours into playing but so far I don't really see any grounds for why the game has got such a bad reputation. The gameplay is solid and it left me wanting to play more. The main downside is the localisation, the game can be intimidating at first and with the wiki being in russian its fairly difficult to look up any guides. If you get past that however the game is misleadingly simple with some hit and miss skill descriptions.

In short it's a really good co-operative turn-based shooter vs. other players being explained to you by someone who can speak english....for the most part...just think of it as added challenge and it's great.

reviewText:
Hmm... okay...  I'll recommend it... but take it with a grain of salt, this game could be better.

I don't have too many hours on record but I did enjoy the time I put into it. After the first 3-4 matches... I finally figured out that I could win nearly every match simply by outmaneuvering the enemy team and taking their flag with one soldier and bumrushing middle with my other. Most players are willing to waste action points to shoot at you while I'm using them to push in further to their territory. Most matches I never fired a single round. Which is sad... I have yet to truly enjoy a match where my positioning made a huge difference and that we were able to annihalate the other team.


Pros:
-Free game.... it's not hurting you to not play it.
-Actually quite tactical with some decent co-op potential
-Great Concept and the soldiers look awesome
-Russia
-Smaller and Larger scale engagements
-Command 1 - 4 soldiers at a time in cooperation with your fellow teamates
-I've played freemium games that annoy the snot out of you to buy their premium content,,, and I feel like this one is leaving me alone to make that choice myself instead of shoving it in my face.

Cons:
- You can definitely pay to win... Some may argue you can aquire that premium currency for free by playing enough but that doesn't defeat the fact that I could pay them right now and have some gear to give me a MAJOR edge from the get-go. Things like weapons, armor, enhanced healing, vision, sprint distance that can make/break a victory or defeat.
- Unless I'm wrong... there's only CTF mode... turns into multiple flags later but still no fight to the death mode that I have found yet.
- Matches are too quick due to the CTF mode. Every turn gains points and after one team holds the majority, the points multiply insanely quick. Making the priority to push the other player off the point and forego any other possible tactic... Simply shooting a person off a point rarely works unless you've beat them down some prior to their assault
- Feels a bit grindy... and not enough incentive to keep doing so.
- I could play this on my phone, and be happier with it.


The game honestly just makes me want to buy XCOM 2 for a turn based tactical strategy.

reviewText:
The game looked allright on the first day but then it turns out stupid.

You're limited to 2 players on the same team, 2 players commanding 2 soldiers, that leaves 4 bots in your team. Unless you buy premium that is really expensive. So pray u dont play against a team of premiums.

Bots are really dumb, they just run around away from battle doing nothing. They made the option to give them 3 simple orders but not if they are to far away ( that means close to you) so if u want to command a bot to do something u have to run after him.
You also have command points, but not enough to command every bots, and the more turns u get into the more expensive they cost, u can barely command 1 bot every 2 or 3 turns.
The best thing is that when u command a bot to guard a point u can expect the command to vanish after a few turns so u have to get back to him running away and tell him to get back to his spot hoping he doesnt get killed on the way because.
The best way to play is to not taking care of the bots and just use your 2 soldiers hoping u dont have premiums in front of u.

They've put the opportunity to heal your soldiers, so just run in the fight, shoot, get shot, retreat, heal for 1 turn and get back in the fight, u can do that as long as u want and u wont die.
Sounds stupid for a turn based strategy game no ?

They are a few bugs but nothing dramatical, the gameplay is getting really bad and the more u advance the more u can feel that u cant build a real strategy unless u spend a lot and a lot of money. When u see the prices u can just fall off ur chair, never seen a game that expensive.

It could be a nice multi game but now i understand why people just get fed up so quickly. It's made for people who want to wack newcomers with cash like i've red on other games.

reviewText:
****ALL COMENTS AND RATINGS PRIOR TO 2016 SHOULD BE IGNORED****

There are reviews prior to 2016, which are mostly negative and describe stuff, that I didnt notice in this release. Here is a review  of a game, that came to steam one week ago.

- it is a turn based strategy online game with researching stuff for your soldiers
- the game is completely in english
- it is not easy ( since rank 3 you will suffer even against npcs)
-YES, you play against npcs very often, because atm there is not enough population, even though the game deserves it ( the npsc have names of offline players. Sometimes you spot an online player, whom you recoginize by a yellow star next to his/her name
-you can play in groups up to 2 players ( without premium ) and 4 with premium , each player can cotrol up to 4 soldiers, from 8 soldiers total per battle
-you can get premium currency in low amounts by just playing the game
-its tactical, not just run spot and kill, you need to learn each unit gameplay and ways to counter it

The combat i would compare to x-com games and the research phase... 1st on mind came WoT.

Recommended
voteText: 5 of 8 people (63%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
There are some things I like:
-turn-based gameplay
-different soldier types
-different weapons
-some research & outfitting possibilities
And much more I don't like:
-time for moves is too short (interface too clumsy)
-AI is dumb (and you nearly always have AI bots in your team)
-it's free-to-play, but it will take ages to get decent gear
-only very few different maps to play on
-tactical possibities are limited (not enough time to plan moves)
-strategy? well, no need for such things
-very pay-heavy (but you get lots of discounts)
-orders to team bots are a joke (not enough time...you know the drill by now)
-classes not balanced
-wasted potential, sorry to say that
Conclusion: look for 'Ja2 1.13' in your search engine, much better turn-based tactics

reviewText: Okay not a bad game but infurating when you get slow players on the enemy team that take forever to make their turns especailly when there is 8 players on either side. The chat is useless since no-one English uses it. Not a bad game but you must play windowed mode and do something else when you got a really slow game. I recomend it for people who like stratagy games like X-com but watch out this game can make you want to throttle the opponents for taking their sweet time with all their soldiers\n\nThere are few actual people playing this game who use stratagies to fight you other than brute force. I went with half of my guys being commandos one to go and spot and capture and the other to snipe anything that is unfortunate enough to enter her sights. It's pathetic on how few people realize a sniper should be your #1 target when they are visible.

reviewText:
If you like tactical turn-based games like X-COM multiplayer, look no further. This game is better in every way that matters.

Pro's:
-NOT PAY TO WIN (everything can be bought with in-game currency)
-Strategic turn-based gameplay allows for deep tactics and proper team co-op
-Good graphics and well optimized (60 fps on highest settings on most PC's)
-Frequent Updates and patches
-Very active and friendly, mature community
-Loads of content (weapons / items / armor / classes / maps etc...)
-Clan Wars
-Leaderboards with season awards
-Daily / Weekly and special events
-Easy to get into, challenging to master
-eSport potential

Con's:
-English localization could use a little work (Devs have acknowledged this and are actively working on a fix)

I've put in over 100 hours in the non-Steam client. Amazing game and community, game keeps getting better with every update.

9.75/10
Completely blows X-COM out of the water in multiplayer. Download now, the only thing you might regret is all the free time it will suck out of your schedule.

reviewText:
I not a reviewer in any way so here goes this game for me is a mixed bag I LOVE turn based squad games and have been looking for a co-op ish game something like this and when I found this one i was pleasntly suprised. Until I put in the hours ive played so far this CAN"  be a great game but theres so many problems with it that they need to fix.

1) some of the classes are WAY to overpowered and others are underwhelming by far
The sniper class is the best ive seen when it comes to raw dmg and accuracy barely misses and does about 30-90 dmg a shot all you can do is move out of there field of vision and even that cant save you if they have ambush shot on die the moment you try to run stay and get headshot. The grandier and heavy grandier ive seen land full clean hit form halfway down the map and do just as much if not more than the sniper pretty sure a grenade lanucher cant fire 900+m down the map and "HIT EVEN IN COVER" through trees and buildings and usually breaks a few limbs on every hit. While other classes are so bad their unplayable such as: the gunner(support)
date: heavy gunner(support) take 3 turns to setup range is okay but they can use cover and just sit out the open till they get shot to death in 1 turn
recommended: rpg lanucher(support) range/dmg is a JOKE and takes a full turn to reload and chance to hit is awful in what world does a noob tube better in every single way than a RPG(ROCKET PROPALLED GREANDE)
hoursPlayed: and flamethrower(heavy inf) which isnt a flamethrower unit all same as the rpg but WORSE just shoots rocket that deal 1 dmg and then lite the gorund on fire which you think would help but nope they just walk off of it and then kill you while you WASTE your turn reloading sapper(commando) lays traps and mines ive never seen anyone play them in my 300+ games so whats that tell ya these are all WORTHLESS when it comes to dmg combat skills and over gameplay\n\n2) The pay to win is REAL in this game

reviewText: Server response times are the worst I've seen in a long time, it took 30 seconds to a minute for the server to respond to nearly every action I took in the tutorial at nearly 2 am. reviewText: The game seems to be in development, but it's off to a great start. Earlier reviews mention english as issue, but it has mostly been resolved. It's very similar to x-com if it had a continuous stealth feature. There are mechs, granades, mines, missles, artillary, and bases to capture. The battle field is complex and a bigger gun doens't always mean you win. I've taken part in many battles watching my team get slaugther and so pulled my troops back and sent my spies into to claim their bases and win a victory even as they overwhelmed my main force.\n\nThe game is also gear intensive and that is actaully how your lvl is determiend so character you've been using forever can go out with the lowbies as long as he's using lowbie gear, so you can play with any of your friends who might be now to game.
